message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CL. 

The paper focuses on training deep convolutional neural networks for large-scale online handwritten Chinese character recognition, which is a problem in computer vision (CV). Therefore, cs.CV is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a new training method, which involves dynamically adjusting the training data based on the classification confidence given by the DCNN softmax output. This is a technique related to machine learning (ML) and specifically deep learning (DL), which suggests that cs.LG and cs.AI are also likely sub-categories. The paper also mentions the use of domain-specific knowledge to enhance the performance of DCNN, which involves incorporating knowledge from the field of information retrieval (IR) and natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.IR and cs.CL are also possible sub-categories.
